f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (02:30): eternauta: To do so you either want to convert it to base64 and store in a text field (I'd recommend this route...more portable data. See http://blog.nanoshock.net on that vein) or use a blob field.

ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (02:30): will[wErK] asked me to tell you this: Using Images in BLOBs: http://www.hashmysql.org/index.php?title=Using_Pictures_in_BLOBs ---- Move to Store Images in the Database: http://www.oracle.com/technology/products/intermedia/htdocs/why_images_in_database.html (Thanks xah)
